config_text:
name = "clippy"
subteam-of = "devtools"

[people]
leads = ["Manishearth", "flip1995"]
members = [
    "llogiq",
    "killercup",
    "Manishearth",
    "oli-obk",
    "matthiaskrgr",
    "phansch",
    "mikerite",
    "flip1995",
    "mcarton",
    "yaahc",
    "ebroto",
]

[permissions]
bors.clippy.review = true

[[github]]
orgs = ["rust-lang"]

[website]
name = "Clippy team"
description = "Designing and implementing the Clippy linter"
zulip-stream = "clippy"

# I use a lot of dumb names in the tests
blacklisted-names = []

# This complexity is just a little higher than the most complex
# function at the time of adding this config file. Ideally, we should
# set the threshold even lower, but that would break current code.
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 24
# Prevents treating CamelCase names in doc comments as identifiers and
# suggesting backticks
doc-valid-idents = [ "LoRa" ]

# See full lints list at:
# https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html

doc-valid-idents = [
    "KiB", "MiB", "GiB", "TiB", "PiB", "EiB",
    "DirectX", "ECMAScript",
    "GPLv2", "GPLv3", "GitHub", "GitLab",
    "IPv4", "IPv6", "JavaScript", "NaN", "NaNs",
    "OAuth", "OpenGL", "OpenSSH", "OpenSSL", "OpenStreetMap", "TrueType",
    "iOS", "macOS", "TeX", "LaTeX", "BibTeX", "BibLaTeX", "MinGW",
    "WebRTC", "WebSocket",
    "MediaStream", "MediaStreamConstraints", "MediaStreamTrack",
    "RTCConfiguration", "RTCIceCandidate", "RTCIceServer",
    "RTCPeerConnection", "RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent",
    "RTCRtpTransceiver", "RTCRtpTransceiverDirection",
    "RTCSdpType", "RTCIceCandidateInit"
]

# The default clippy value for this is 8 bytes, which is chosen to improve performance on 32-bit.
# Given that druid is being designed for the future and already even mobile phones have 64-bit CPUs,
# it makes sense to optimize for 64-bit and accept the performance hits on 32-bit.
# 16 bytes is the number of bytes that fits into two 64-bit CPU registers.
trivial-copy-size-limit = 16

blacklisted-names = []
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 15
# I HAVE THE POWER OF OLEG
type-complexity-threshold = 999999

# that one is an error
foobar = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# this is ignored by Clippy, but allowed for other tools like clippy-service
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 13

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 13

type-complexity-threshold = 700 #specs sometimes results in unavoidable large types
too-many-arguments-threshold = 13 #as above, display functions need lots of args

[package]
name = "clippy"
version = "0.0.212"
authors = [
	"Manish Goregaokar <manishsmail@gmail.com>",
	"Andre Bogus <bogusandre@gmail.com>",
	"Georg Brandl <georg@python.org>",
	"Martin Carton <cartonmartin@gmail.com>",
	"Oliver Schneider <clippy-iethah7aipeen8neex1a@oli-obk.de>"
]
description = "A bunch of helpful lints to avoid common pitfalls in Rust"
repository = "https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy"
readme = "README.md"
license = "MIT OR Apache-2.0"
keywords = ["clippy", "lint", "plugin"]
categories = ["development-tools", "development-tools::cargo-plugins"]
build = "build.rs"
edition = "2018"
publish = false

# [badges]
# FIXME(flip1995): Add GHA badge once rust-lang/crates.io#1838 is merged

[[bin]]
name = "cargo-clippy"
test = false
path = "src/main.rs"

[[bin]]
name = "clippy-driver"
path = "src/driver.rs"

[dependencies]
# begin automatic update
clippy_lints = { version = "0.0.212", path = "clippy_lints" }
# end automatic update
regex = "1"
semver = "0.9"
rustc_tools_util = { version = "0.2.0", path = "rustc_tools_util"}
git2 = { version = "0.12", optional = true }
tempfile = { version = "3.1.0", optional = true }
lazy_static = "1.0"

[dev-dependencies]
cargo_metadata = "0.9.0"
compiletest_rs = { version = "0.4.0", features = ["tmp"] }
tester = "0.7"
lazy_static = "1.0"
clippy-mini-macro-test = { version = "0.2", path = "mini-macro" }
serde = { version = "1.0", features = ["derive"] }
derive-new = "0.5"

# A noop dependency that changes in the Rust repository, it's a bit of a hack.
# See the `src/tools/rustc-workspace-hack/README.md` file in `rust-lang/rust`
# for more information.
rustc-workspace-hack = "1.0.0"

[build-dependencies]
rustc_tools_util = { version = "0.2.0", path = "rustc_tools_util"}

[features]
deny-warnings = []
integration = ["git2", "tempfile"]

# CommonMark is no rust identifier in our docs :)
doc-valid-idents = ["CommonMark"]

cognitive-complexity-threshold = 25
literal-representation-threshold = 0
enum-variant-name-threshold = 0
enum-variant-size-threshold = 32
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 6
too-many-arguments-threshold = 5
too-many-lines-threshold = 50
trivial-copy-size-limit = 8
verbose-bit-mask-threshold = 1

cognitive-complexity-threshold = 25
literal-representation-threshold = 0
enum-variant-name-threshold = 0
enum-variant-size-threshold = 32
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 4
too-many-arguments-threshold = 5
too-many-lines-threshold = 50
trivial-copy-size-limit = 8
verbose-bit-mask-threshold = 1

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# this is ignored by Clippy, but allowed for other tools like clippy-service
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# that one is an error
foobar = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# Because 7 is just very low, it corresponds to a 6-argument method.
too-many-arguments-threshold = 10

# Additional words to be allowed without backticks by the `doc_markdown` lint.
doc-valid-idents = ["FuseMT"]

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

blacklisted-names = []
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 15
# I HAVE THE POWER OF OLEG
type-complexity-threshold = 999999

blacklisted-names = ["foo", "bar", "baz", "quux"] # default (cf clippy_lints/src/utils/conf.rs)
cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 25 # just for testing (default value)

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# that one is an error
cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# that one is an error
foobar = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# this is ignored by Clippy, but allowed for other tools like clippy-service
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

cognitive-complexity-threshold = 25
literal-representation-threshold = 0
enum-variant-name-threshold = 0
enum-variant-size-threshold = 32
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 4
too-many-arguments-threshold = 5
too-many-lines-threshold = 50
trivial-copy-size-limit = 8
verbose-bit-mask-threshold = 1

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# The lint is kind of stupid, because hex literals don't convey the general size
literal-representation-threshold = 10000000000

# The default clippy value for this is 8 bytes, which is chosen to improve performance on 32-bit.
# Given that kurbo is being designed for the future and already even mobile phones have 64-bit CPUs,
# it makes sense to optimize for 64-bit and accept the performance hits on 32-bit.
# 16 bytes is the number of bytes that fits into two 64-bit CPU registers.
trivial-copy-size-limit = 16

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

blacklisted-names = ["foo", "bar", "baz", "quux"] # default (cf clippy_lints/src/utils/conf.rs)
cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 25 # just for testing (default value)

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# Project configuration for Clippy Rust code linter.
# See full list of lints at:
# https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html

doc-valid-idents = [
    "KiB", "MiB", "GiB", "TiB", "PiB", "EiB",
    "DirectX", "ECMAScript",
    "GPLv2", "GPLv3", "GitHub", "GitLab",
    "IPv4", "IPv6", "JavaScript", "NaN", "NaNs",
    "OAuth", "OpenGL", "OpenSSH", "OpenSSL", "OpenStreetMap", "TrueType",
    "iOS", "macOS", "TeX", "LaTeX", "BibTeX", "BibLaTeX", "MinGW",
    "AllatRa", "FFmpeg", "TeamSpeak", "YouTube",
]

# We use some complex types here, this gives us a little more wiggle room
type-complexity-threshold = 450

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 13

blacklisted-names = []
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 15
# I HAVE THE POWER OF OLEG
type-complexity-threshold = 999999

cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 30

too-many-lines-threshold = 80 # TODO: make this more restrictive later
too-many-arguments-threshold = 5 # TODO: make this more restrictive later
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 20

# This file is part of .cargo. It is subject to the license terms in the COPYRIGHT file found in the top-level directory of this distribution and at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lemonrock/.cargo/master/COPYRIGHT. No part of rust1, including this file, may be copied, modified, propagated, or distributed except according to the terms contained in the COPYRIGHT file.
# Copyright © 2016 The developers of .cargo. See the COPYRIGHT file in the top-level directory of this distribution and at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lemonrock/.cargo/master/COPYRIGHT.

cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 30

# This file is part of .cargo. It is subject to the license terms in the COPYRIGHT file found in the top-level directory of this distribution and at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lemonrock/.cargo/master/COPYRIGHT. No part of rust1, including this file, may be copied, modified, propagated, or distributed except according to the terms contained in the COPYRIGHT file.
# Copyright © 2016 The developers of .cargo. See the COPYRIGHT file in the top-level directory of this distribution and at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lemonrock/.cargo/master/COPYRIGHT.

cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 30

# hawk headers have a lot of fields, and we pass them positionally..
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# This file is part of .cargo. It is subject to the license terms in the COPYRIGHT file found in the top-level directory of this distribution and at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lemonrock/.cargo/master/COPYRIGHT. No part of rust1, including this file, may be copied, modified, propagated, or distributed except according to the terms contained in the COPYRIGHT file.
# Copyright © 2016 The developers of .cargo. See the COPYRIGHT file in the top-level directory of this distribution and at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lemonrock/.cargo/master/COPYRIGHT.

cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 30

# This file is part of .cargo. It is subject to the license terms in the COPYRIGHT file found in the top-level directory of this distribution and at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lemonrock/.cargo/master/COPYRIGHT. No part of rust1, including this file, may be copied, modified, propagated, or distributed except according to the terms contained in the COPYRIGHT file.
# Copyright © 2016 The developers of .cargo. See the COPYRIGHT file in the top-level directory of this distribution and at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lemonrock/.cargo/master/COPYRIGHT.

cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 30

# hawk headers have a lot of fields, and we pass them positionally..
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# Additional words to be allowed without backticks by the `doc_markdown` lint.
doc-valid-idents = ["FastCGI"]

assert_on_constants = "deny"
blacklisted_name = "deny"
block_in_if_condition_expr = "deny"
block_in_if_condition_stmt = "deny"
bool_comparison = "deny"
borrowed_box = "deny"
box_vec = "deny"
boxed_local = "deny"
builtin_type_shadow = "deny"
cast_lossless = "deny"
cast_sign_loss = "deny"
clone_on_ref_ptr = "deny"
# TODO: More lints

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# Every not-deprecated clippy variable written explicitly, from 
# https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/blob/0e5e2c436584ca9ad02d3c7edec8ffa116f1419f/clippy_lints/src/utils/conf.rs#L108-L161

# Lint: BLACKLISTED-NAME. The list of blacklisted names to lint about
blacklisted-names = ["foo", "bar", "baz", "quux"]
# Lint: COGNITIVE-COMPLEXITY. The maximum cognitive complexity a function can have
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 15 #25 <-- default value
# Lint: DOC-MARKDOWN. The list of words this lint should not consider as identifiers needing ticks
doc-valid-idents = [
  "KiB", "MiB", "GiB", "TiB", "PiB", "EiB",
  "DirectX",
  "ECMAScript",
  "GPLv2", "GPLv3",
  "GitHub", "GitLab",
  "IPv4", "IPv6",
  "JavaScript",
  "NaN", "NaNs",
  "OAuth",
  "OpenGL", "OpenSSH", "OpenSSL", "OpenStreetMap",
  "TrueType",
  "iOS", "macOS",
  "TeX", "LaTeX", "BibTeX", "BibLaTeX",
  "MinGW",
  "CamelCase",
  "SQLite", "PostgreSQL", "MySQL", # added
  "IPv4", "IPv6" # added
]
# Lint: TOO-MANY-ARGUMENTS. The maximum number of argument a function or method can have
too-many-arguments-threshold = 4 #7
# Lint: TYPE-COMPLEXITY. The maximum complexity a type can have
type-complexity-threshold = 150 #250
# Lint: MANY-SINGLE-CHAR-NAMES. The maximum number of single char bindings a scope may have
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 3 #5
# Lint: BOXED-LOCAL. The maximum size of objects (in bytes) that will be linted. Larger objects are ok on the heap
too-large-for-stack = 200
# Lint: ENUM-VARIANT-NAMES. The minimum number of enum variants for the lints about variant names to trigger
enum-variant-name-threshold = 2 #3
# Lint: LARGE-ENUM-VARIANT. The maximum size of a enum's variant to avoid box suggestion
enum-variant-size-threshold = 200
# Lint: VERBOSE-BIT-MASK. The maximum allowed size of a bit mask before suggesting to use 'trailing-zeros'
verbose-bit-mask-threshold = 1
# Lint: DECIMAL-LITERAL-REPRESENTATION. The lower bound for linting decimal literals
literal-representation-threshold = 16384
# Lint: TRIVIALLY-COPY-PASS-BY-REF. The maximum size (in bytes) to consider a `Copy` type for passing by value instead of by reference.
trivial-copy-size-limit = 8
# Lint: TOO-MANY-LINES. The maximum number of lines a function or method can have
too-many-lines-threshold = 20 #100
# Lint: LARGE-STACK-ARRAYS. The maximum allowed size for arrays on the stack
array-size-threshold = 512000
# Lint: VEC-BOX. The size of the boxed type in bytes, where boxing in a `Vec` is allowed
vec-box-size-threshold = 4096
# Lint: STRUCT-EXCESSIVE-BOOLS. The maximum number of bools a struct can have
# not working: max-struct-bools = 3
# Lint: FN-PARAMS-EXCESSIVE-BOOLS. The maximum number of bools function parameters can have
# not working: max-fn-params-bools = 1 #3

# hawk headers have a lot of fields, and we pass them positionally..
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# Every not-deprecated clippy variable written explicitly, from 
# https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/blob/0e5e2c436584ca9ad02d3c7edec8ffa116f1419f/clippy_lints/src/utils/conf.rs#L108-L161

# Lint: BLACKLISTED-NAME. The list of blacklisted names to lint about
blacklisted-names = ["foo", "bar", "baz", "quux"]
# Lint: COGNITIVE-COMPLEXITY. The maximum cognitive complexity a function can have
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 15 #25 <-- default value
# Lint: DOC-MARKDOWN. The list of words this lint should not consider as identifiers needing ticks
doc-valid-idents = [
  "KiB", "MiB", "GiB", "TiB", "PiB", "EiB",
  "DirectX",
  "ECMAScript",
  "GPLv2", "GPLv3",
  "GitHub", "GitLab",
  "IPv4", "IPv6",
  "JavaScript",
  "NaN", "NaNs",
  "OAuth",
  "OpenGL", "OpenSSH", "OpenSSL", "OpenStreetMap",
  "TrueType",
  "iOS", "macOS",
  "TeX", "LaTeX", "BibTeX", "BibLaTeX",
  "MinGW",
  "CamelCase",
  "SQLite", "PostgreSQL", "MySQL", # added
  "IPv4", "IPv6" # added
]
# Lint: TOO-MANY-ARGUMENTS. The maximum number of argument a function or method can have
too-many-arguments-threshold = 4 #7
# Lint: TYPE-COMPLEXITY. The maximum complexity a type can have
type-complexity-threshold = 150 #250
# Lint: MANY-SINGLE-CHAR-NAMES. The maximum number of single char bindings a scope may have
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 3 #5
# Lint: BOXED-LOCAL. The maximum size of objects (in bytes) that will be linted. Larger objects are ok on the heap
too-large-for-stack = 200
# Lint: ENUM-VARIANT-NAMES. The minimum number of enum variants for the lints about variant names to trigger
enum-variant-name-threshold = 2 #3
# Lint: LARGE-ENUM-VARIANT. The maximum size of a enum's variant to avoid box suggestion
enum-variant-size-threshold = 200
# Lint: VERBOSE-BIT-MASK. The maximum allowed size of a bit mask before suggesting to use 'trailing-zeros'
verbose-bit-mask-threshold = 1
# Lint: DECIMAL-LITERAL-REPRESENTATION. The lower bound for linting decimal literals
literal-representation-threshold = 16384
# Lint: TRIVIALLY-COPY-PASS-BY-REF. The maximum size (in bytes) to consider a `Copy` type for passing by value instead of by reference.
trivial-copy-size-limit = 8
# Lint: TOO-MANY-LINES. The maximum number of lines a function or method can have
too-many-lines-threshold = 20 #100
# Lint: LARGE-STACK-ARRAYS. The maximum allowed size for arrays on the stack
array-size-threshold = 512000
# Lint: VEC-BOX. The size of the boxed type in bytes, where boxing in a `Vec` is allowed
vec-box-size-threshold = 4096
# Lint: STRUCT-EXCESSIVE-BOOLS. The maximum number of bools a struct can have
# not working: max-struct-bools = 3
# Lint: FN-PARAMS-EXCESSIVE-BOOLS. The maximum number of bools function parameters can have
# not working: max-fn-params-bools = 1 #3

cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 30

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 13

# that one is an error
foobar = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# that one is an error
cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# this is ignored by Clippy, but allowed for other tools like clippy-service
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# that one is an error
cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# that one is an error
foobar = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# this is ignored by Clippy, but allowed for other tools like clippy-service
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# that one is an error
foobar = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# this is ignored by Clippy, but allowed for other tools like clippy-service
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# that one is an error
cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# that one is an error
foobar = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# hawk headers have a lot of fields, and we pass them positionally..
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# As of this writing, the default is 200; so we're actually more strict than
# the default here
enum-variant-size-threshold = 96

blacklisted-names = ["foo", "bar", "baz", "quux"] # default (cf clippy_lints/src/utils/conf.rs)
cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 25 # just for testing (default value)

doc-valid-idents = ["BFFFS"]
# I don't like this warning.  I use a lot of single char variable names, both to
# keep the line length down and when I'm writing mathy stuff.
single-char-binding-names-threshold=1000
# Optimize for 64-bit architectures
trivial-copy-size-limit=8

# hawk headers have a lot of fields, and we pass them positionally..
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# As of this writing, the default is 200; so we're actually more strict than
# the default here
enum-variant-size-threshold = 96

doc-valid-idents = ["BFFFS"]
# I don't like this warning.  I use a lot of single char variable names, both to
# keep the line length down and when I'm writing mathy stuff.
single-char-binding-names-threshold=1000
# Optimize for 64-bit architectures
trivial-copy-size-limit=8

# The default clippy value for this is 8 bytes, which is chosen to improve performance on 32-bit.
# Given that druid is being designed for the future and already even mobile phones have 64-bit CPUs,
# it makes sense to optimize for 64-bit and accept the performance hits on 32-bit.
# 16 bytes is the number of bytes that fits into two 64-bit CPU registers.
trivial-copy-size-limit = 16

cognitive-complexity-threshold = 20
# this attribute should be project specific (values can be customized as per project)
blacklisted-names = ["foo", "too"]
enum-variant-name-threshold = 3
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 0
too-many-arguments-threshold = 3
# pedantic (for these configs you have to provide `#[warn(clippy::pedantic)]` in you bin or lib file)
max-fn-params-bools = 3
max-struct-bools = 3
too-many-lines-threshold = 25

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 13

cognitive-complexity-threshold = 20
# this attribute should be project specific (values can be customized as per project)
blacklisted-names = ["foo", "too"]
enum-variant-name-threshold = 3
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 0
too-many-arguments-threshold = 3
# pedantic (for these configs you have to provide `#[warn(clippy::pedantic)]` in you bin or lib file)
max-fn-params-bools = 3
max-struct-bools = 3
too-many-lines-threshold = 25

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# that one is an error
cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# that one is an error
foobar = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# this is ignored by Clippy, but allowed for other tools like clippy-service
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# We use enums for state machines, which can grow quite large by design
enum-variant-size-threshold = 2048

# We use enums for state machines, which can grow quite large by design
enum-variant-size-threshold = 2048

# We use enums for state machines, which can grow quite large by design
enum-variant-size-threshold = 2048

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 13

# hawk headers have a lot of fields, and we pass them positionally..
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# cyclomatic complexity is not always useful
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 100
# types are used for safety encoding
type-complexity-threshold = 10000
# manipulating complex states machines in consensus
too-many-arguments-threshold = 13

# hawk headers have a lot of fields, and we pass them positionally..
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

blacklisted-names = []
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 15
# I HAVE THE POWER OF OLEG
type-complexity-threshold = 999999
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 30

# Every not-deprecated clippy variable written explicitly, from 
# https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/blob/0e5e2c436584ca9ad02d3c7edec8ffa116f1419f/clippy_lints/src/utils/conf.rs#L108-L161

# Lint: BLACKLISTED-NAME. The list of blacklisted names to lint about
blacklisted-names = ["foo", "bar", "baz", "quux"]
# Lint: COGNITIVE-COMPLEXITY. The maximum cognitive complexity a function can have
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 15 #25 <-- default value
# Lint: DOC-MARKDOWN. The list of words this lint should not consider as identifiers needing ticks
doc-valid-idents = [
  "KiB", "MiB", "GiB", "TiB", "PiB", "EiB",
  "DirectX",
  "ECMAScript",
  "GPLv2", "GPLv3",
  "GitHub", "GitLab",
  "IPv4", "IPv6",
  "JavaScript",
  "NaN", "NaNs",
  "OAuth",
  "OpenGL", "OpenSSH", "OpenSSL", "OpenStreetMap",
  "TrueType",
  "iOS", "macOS",
  "TeX", "LaTeX", "BibTeX", "BibLaTeX",
  "MinGW",
  "CamelCase",
  "SQLite", "PostgreSQL", "MySQL", # added
  "IPv4", "IPv6" # added
]
# Lint: TOO-MANY-ARGUMENTS. The maximum number of argument a function or method can have
too-many-arguments-threshold = 4 #7
# Lint: TYPE-COMPLEXITY. The maximum complexity a type can have
type-complexity-threshold = 150 #250
# Lint: MANY-SINGLE-CHAR-NAMES. The maximum number of single char bindings a scope may have
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 3 #5
# Lint: BOXED-LOCAL. The maximum size of objects (in bytes) that will be linted. Larger objects are ok on the heap
too-large-for-stack = 200
# Lint: ENUM-VARIANT-NAMES. The minimum number of enum variants for the lints about variant names to trigger
enum-variant-name-threshold = 2 #3
# Lint: LARGE-ENUM-VARIANT. The maximum size of a enum's variant to avoid box suggestion
enum-variant-size-threshold = 200
# Lint: VERBOSE-BIT-MASK. The maximum allowed size of a bit mask before suggesting to use 'trailing-zeros'
verbose-bit-mask-threshold = 1
# Lint: DECIMAL-LITERAL-REPRESENTATION. The lower bound for linting decimal literals
literal-representation-threshold = 16384
# Lint: TRIVIALLY-COPY-PASS-BY-REF. The maximum size (in bytes) to consider a `Copy` type for passing by value instead of by reference.
trivial-copy-size-limit = 8
# Lint: TOO-MANY-LINES. The maximum number of lines a function or method can have
too-many-lines-threshold = 20 #100
# Lint: LARGE-STACK-ARRAYS. The maximum allowed size for arrays on the stack
array-size-threshold = 512000
# Lint: VEC-BOX. The size of the boxed type in bytes, where boxing in a `Vec` is allowed
vec-box-size-threshold = 4096
# Lint: STRUCT-EXCESSIVE-BOOLS. The maximum number of bools a struct can have
# not working: max-struct-bools = 3
# Lint: FN-PARAMS-EXCESSIVE-BOOLS. The maximum number of bools function parameters can have
# not working: max-fn-params-bools = 1 #3

# hawk headers have a lot of fields, and we pass them positionally..
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# hawk headers have a lot of fields, and we pass them positionally..
too-many-arguments-threshold = 15

# The default clippy value for this is 8 bytes, which is chosen to improve performance on 32-bit.
# Given that piet is being designed for the future and already even mobile phones have 64-bit CPUs,
# it makes sense to optimize for 64-bit and accept the performance hits on 32-bit.
# 16 bytes is the number of bytes that fits into two 64-bit CPU registers.
trivial-copy-size-limit = 16

# clippy configuration file.
# For a list of lint rules see https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html

# Code Complete recommends a max cyclomatic complexity of 10.
# For situations where more complex code is needed please 
# include a comment of why it is needed in that situation.
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 10

# We understand that too many args is bad, but we can figure it out ourselves.
too-many-arguments-threshold = 100

blacklisted-names = []
single-char-binding-names-threshold = 15
# I HAVE THE POWER OF OLEG
type-complexity-threshold = 999999
cognitive-complexity-threshold = 30

cyclomatic-complexity-threshold = 42

# that one is white-listed
[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# that one is an error
foobar = 42

[third-party]
clippy-feature = "nightly"

# it makes sense to optimize for 64-bit and accept the performance hits on 32-bit.
# 16 bytes is the number of bytes that fits into two 64-bit CPU registers.
trivial-copy-size-limit = 16
